metadata.title: USN-6908-1 -- Tomcat vulnerabilities
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Tomcat SSI printenv command echoed user provided data without escaping it. An attacker could possibly use this issue to perform an XSS attack. (CVE-2019-0221)  It was discovered that Tomcat incorrectly handled certain uncommon PersistenceManager with FileStore configurations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2020-9484, CVE-2021-25329)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6908-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 libservlet3.0-java-doc - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 tomcat7-docs - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.4+esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
